meanings.definition: The period of time before written records but after prehistory.
meanings.sent1: In protohistory, people did not have written records to learn about the past.
meanings.sent2: Researchers study protohistory to understand ancient civilizations.
meanings.sent3: The archaeologist joked that in protohistory, people probably communicated through cave drawings.
meanings.sent4: Exploring protohistory is like piecing together a puzzle without all the pieces.
meanings.sent5: The teacher made protohistory come alive by showing artifacts from that era.

meanings.definition: The study of societies that existed before written records.
meanings.sent1: Protohistory helps us learn about ancient cultures without written documents.
meanings.sent2: Anthropologists use protohistory to uncover the mysteries of early civilizations.
meanings.sent3: The students found it amusing that protohistory could reveal so much about the past.
meanings.sent4: The layers of protohistory are like layers of history waiting to be uncovered.
meanings.sent5: Imagining life in protohistory requires creativity and curiosity.
